Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: glazed streaky black; faded added white rays around foot above two white bands and band of dots.
Curator's comments: Decorated chalice feet are uncommon. For other decorated Simple Animal Style feet, see Lemos nos. 1200 and 1201 from Gordion. See also British Museum 1965,0930.472 and 729.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0993) (phase 2)
